comments:
I had the code:
 IPluginDescriptor descriptor =
 TomcatPlugin.getDefault().getDescriptor();
 URL installURL = descriptor.getInstallURL();
 String home = Platform.resolve(installURL).getFile();

In 20030119 build:
 home is "/" as Platform.resolve(installURL) returns "bundleentry:65/".

I tried to fix my code by using Platform.asLocalURL() that according to 
Javadoc should take the URL from descriptor and return file: or jar:
 IPluginDescriptor descriptor =
 TomcatPlugin.getDefault().getDescriptor();
 URL installURL = descriptor.getInstallURL();
 String home = Platform.asLocalURL(installURL).getFile();
Instead Platform.asLocalURL(installURL) throws IOException:

java.io.IOException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.asLocalURL
(InternalPlatform.java:215)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.asLocalURL(Platform.java:226)
	at org.eclipse.tomcat.internal.TomcatAppServer.start
(TomcatAppServer.java:71)

A workaround was to use Platform.asLocalURL(Platform.resolve(installURL)).

This has been fixed for this week I build.
Sorry for the perturbation around this area.
